action.action-desc: Mr. Thompson of Pennsylvania (for himself, Mr. Langevin, and Mr. Young of Iowa) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To amend title 36, United States Code, to update the Federal charter for Future Farmers of America.

subsection.text: This Act may be cited as the National FFA Organization’s Federal Charter Amendments Act.
The table of contents for this Act is as follows:

section.text: Section 70902 of title 36, United States Code, is amended to read as follows:
The purposes of the corporation are—

paragraph.text: to be an integral component of instruction in agricultural, food, and natural resources education in the United States, including in public schools, by—

subparagraph.text: working with secondary schools to deliver comprehensive agricultural, food, and natural resources education programs;
providing hands-on classroom and laboratory instruction, work-based experiential learning, and leadership development;
preparing students for successful entry into careers related to agriculture, food, and natural resources; and
connecting students to jobs and educational opportunities related to agriculture, food, and natural resources;

paragraph.text: to provide educational materials, conferences, events, and technical assistance to State and local agricultural, food, and natural resources education agencies;
to seek and promote inclusion and diversity in its membership, leadership, and staff to reflect the belief of the corporation in the value of all human beings;
to create, foster, and assist subordinate associations and chapters;
to build character and thereby develop competent and assertive leadership;
to increase awareness of the global and technological importance of agriculture, food, and natural resources and its contribution to well-being;
to promote careers related to agriculture, food, and natural resources;
to make available to subordinate associations, chapters, and members all official supplies, equipment, programs, and services of the corporation;
to cooperate with others, including State boards for career and technical education, in accomplishing these purposes; and
to engage in other activities, consistent with these purposes, determined by the governing body to be for the best interests of the corporation.

Section 70904(a) of title 36, United States Code, is amended—

by inserting after paragraph (1) the following:
The board consists of—

a designee of the Secretary who has experience with agricultural, food, and natural resources education, career and technical education, or the corporation.

paragraph.text: The chair of the board is as provided in the constitution or bylaws of the corporation.
The board shall designate among the individuals of the board a national advisor.
The board shall designate among the individuals of the board described in paragraph (2)(A) an executive secretary and treasurer.

The number of directors, the term of office for the directors, and the method of selecting the directors (except ex officio directors) are as provided in the constitution or bylaws of the corporation.

subsection.text: Section 70904(b) of title 36, United States Code, is amended to read as follows:

paragraph.text: The board shall designate at least three members of the board of directors as a governing committee. The terms and method of selecting such committee members are as provided in the constitution or bylaws of the corporation, except that the board shall designate to such committee—

When the board is not in session, the governing committee shall have the powers of the board subject to the board’s discretion and may authorize the seal of the corporation to be affixed to all papers that require it.
